awd_titl_txt: Conference: Recent Advances and Past Accomplishments in Harmonic Analysis
awd_abstract_narration:
Harmonic analysis is a foundational subject that touches upon many different areas of mathematics. Much early interest in the subject centered around Calderón-Zygmund operators and the theory connected to them. Recent interest in harmonic analysis has been in the construction of different wavelet bases and utilizing them in medical applications, imaging, and data analysis. The workshop on Harmonic Analysis will take place at Washington University in St. Louis on October 8-9, 2022. The purpose is to bring together researchers in harmonic analysis so that new ideas and past accomplishments in the field can be discussed by both experts and young mathematicians. The conference's principal speaker will provide an overview of some recent developments in real and complex harmonic analysis, including their relations to efficient high dimensional data processing. Other contributions will highlight both recent advances in the area as well as past accomplishments.

The primary goal of this project will be to provide participant support and fund advanced graduate students and recent Ph.D.s, allowing them to attend this major conference on analysis, discuss new ideas, and interact with established researchers. These interactions will be facilitated by the breaks and discussion sessions that will be part of the schedule. Advertisement for the conference will take place on the Department of Mathematics and Statistics website and through email announcements. More information about the conference can be found at the website: http://guidomemorial.wustl.edu

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

por.por_cntn:
The conference supported by the proposal ``Harmonic Analysis at WUSTL: Recent Advances and Past Accomplishments'' provided major benefits to both junior career researchers and through the dissemination and exchange of ideas.  Focusing on harmonic analysis has the benefit in that this branch of mathematics that investigates the properties of signals and functions and as such has widespread applications in fields like engineering, physics, and computer science.

For junior career researchers, conferences provide a platform to showcase their work and receive valuable feedback from experts in the field. Presenting their research at a conference allows them to gain visibility, establish connections, and potentially collaborate with established researchers. Furthermore, conferences often offer mentorship programs and networking events specifically designed to support early-career professionals, providing them with guidance and mentorship opportunities that can shape their future career paths.

Additionally, conferences facilitate the dissemination of ideas. Researchers present their latest findings, methodologies, and breakthroughs, allowing the wider scientific community to learn about cutting-edge advancements in harmonic analysis. This exchange of knowledge promotes interdisciplinary collaborations and enables researchers to incorporate innovative approaches into their own work. Moreover, attending conferences allows researchers to stay up to date with recent developments, enhancing the quality and relevance of their research.

The exchange of ideas at conferences goes beyond formal presentations. Informal discussions during coffee breaks, poster sessions, and networking events foster vibrant intellectual exchanges. Junior career researchers have the opportunity to engage in conversations with experts in the field, enabling them to gain insights, gather different perspectives, and potentially find solutions to research challenges. These interactions can inspire new research directions and promote the growth of the field as a whole.

This confererence in particular served as a platform for knowledge dissemination, facilitated collaborations, and provided mentorship opportunities. By fostering the exchange of ideas, this conference contributed to the advancement of harmonic analysis and its applications, benefitting both the scientific community and society at large.
